description: Miramar Talaat is a boutique hotel in heart of cairo downtown completely new, Located within 0.5 km of Tahrir Square and 0.4km of The Egyptian Museum, Miramar Talaat Harb provides rooms and suites and family rooms for up to 5 guests. free WiFi. 1.5 km from Cairo Tower, the property is also 2.7 km away from Khan Al Khalili. The hotel has a terrace and Nice Dining area with a panoramic view over the square and a 24-hour front desk. All guest rooms in the hotel are equipped with a electric tea pot. The rooms include air conditioning, a closet and a flat-screen TV, and most units at Miramar have a balcony. A continental breakfast is served each morning at the property. Al-Azhar Mosque is 3.2 km from the accommodation. The nearest airport is Cairo International Airport, 18.5 km from Miramar Talaat Harb.

name: Abdeen Palace Hotel
aminities: ,Free parking,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Wifi,Free breakfast,Bar / lounge,Children Activities (Kid / Family Friendly),Airport transportation,Room service
location: 2 Sabry Abo Alam Street, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Abdeen palace hotel is ideally located in the hub of downtown cairo. Within the vicinity are a number of restaurants and cafes that describe the authentic Egyptian atmosphere. Nearby is the Abdeen Palace itself (5 min. walk) and the Egyptian Museum (10 min. walk). The rooms are comfy and cosy, they bring home away from home.

name: Nile Villa Hotel
location: 8 8 Abd El-Aal Helmy Basha, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: La struttura è un vero e proprio hotel ( non come altri che occupano solo dei piani di alcuni edifici) e ha una bella terrazza per le colazioni proprio sul Nilo. La camera era abbastanza spaziosa con due letti comodi (col piumino imbottito). Non aveva balcone ma 2 finestre vista fiume. La posizione è  abbastanza vicina al centro ma fuori dal traffico quindi, tranne per un pochino di rumore dell'aria condizionata si dorme benissimo.  Il bagno è rifatto da poco, quindi moderno anche se con qualche piccola pecca. Forniscono solo il sapone ma danno le ciabattine. La colazione viene servita in una terrazzina proprio sul fiume, con tanto di ventilatore. E' una colazione egiziana solo salata con dei falafel e le omelette cotte al momento, formaggio, verdure, pane egiziano e the o caffè. Il personale è stato molto gentile, ci hanno accolto a notte fonda e l'autista che è venuto a prenderci all'aeroporto ( per 18 euro) è stato molto cordiale con un'ottima guida. Zona tranquilla. Certamente ci vuole un po' di spirito di adattamento, perchè la pulizia non è proprio agli standard che ci si aspetta e alcuni mobili sono un po' malandati (o coperti di cellophane, non so perchè!) ma in generale per il prezzo che ha ritengo sia una buona scelta di fascia  economica.…

name: Horizon Nile Tower Hotel
location: 20 Aesha Al Taymorya, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: After amazing stay in Cairo with great people everywhere, we have booked a queen room with a private spa and private balcony to finish our stay with a nice stay on the Nile. The owner asked us to do the check-in in the ground floor, to pay (we trusted him) then to go the 20th floor to see our room. When we arrived to the 20th floor, the construction works were juste beside our room (photos attached). There was no private spa in the room and we need to cross the construction works to reach the "common" balcony ... We refused the room, and asked about something else, he told us that was the last room he has ... So we asked to cancel the reservation and to refund us the 140 € that we have just payed. The owner accepted and told us that he will refund us the full amount. Now one month later, the owner didn't refund us anything, he didn't answer my messages, my calls and my emails. We asked Booking. com to intervene, but Booking couldn't do anything as the owner asked us to pay by card in the hotel when we arrived, Booking considered the paiement has been done directly with the hotel. What a shame to have such an hotel in the "Preferred Partners Properties" Programmes of Booking.com. It is a real scam, the owner is not honest, what a shame for the nice Egyptian people to have such a scammer.…

name: Ambiance Cairo Hotel
location: 22 Talaat Harb Street Down Town, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Simply the worst hotel I’ve stayed at in 40 years. The only concern they had about me as their customer was the payment. But they couldn’t even handle a credit card machine. Well, one of the very unprofessional staff could but only after three days of my visit and when the machine was finally charged and could accept US Dollars, not Egyptian pounds (which worked everywhere else with my card). That was the start when arrived late first night. The room didn’t look ready at all, no toilet papers, no safety box, the mini bar was totally empty, no balcony as the description lied about. When I woke up it was even worse. Easily the dirtiest hotel ever. The bedclothes were ripped, had dirty stains AND pubic hair all over (in the shower as well). Smashed mosquitos/bugs on the walls, and the windows behind the curtains, jeez, I got almost sick only by looking how dirty they were. See picture. No organization whatsoever when it comes to clean up the room, if you don’t ask them nothing happens. After three days one of the staff asked me to change room since ”I’ve got a friend coming over”. Well, what about NO my friend I answered. The electricity went out about five times during my week, oh, and I left this horrible place in complete darkness since the lights went when I was just about to leave. Fawlty Towers, please come back, everything is forgiven!…

name: The Emerald Hostel
location: 34 Abdel Khalik Sarwat St, Downtown, Cairo 22222 Egypt
description: Las fotos no se corresponden con la realidad. Cuando inauguraron puede que fuera así, pero ahora esta en mal estado de conservación y muy muy sucio.  No hacen las habitaciones durante la estancia. No cierran las ventanas y entran un montón de mosquitos. Están los cadáveres en las paredes pegados porque no limpian. Matamos unos 15 y todavia nos picaron 15 más. El desayuno muy muy pobre. Los encargados del hotel se unieron a la fiesta de una de las habitaciones y aun pidiéndoles que queríamos dormir pasaron de nosotros y estuvieron toda la noche de risas y música alta. No descansamos nada.

name: Downtown Inn
aminities: ,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Wifi,Hot bath,Free breakfast,Children Activities (Kid / Family Friendly),Airport transportation,Laundry service,Room service
location: 42 Talaat Harb Street, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Unbeatable location, spotless clean room and bath, extremely hospitable hosts - I couldn't ask for more! I checked in late (around 11pm) and it was a smooth process - thanks to Mr. Umar - one of the hosts. Mr. Umar is always happy to share words of wisdom from his decades of experience and I really appreciate all the food and travel tips I got from him! Mr. Ibrahim, the other host is a resourceful and energetic young man. This cool dude gave me loads of tour options (even for other cities like Aswan and Luxor), helped me exchange currency, arranged transportation. Between them and the very helpful Moustafa and Mary there's always someone at front desk, eager to assist.  There's a ton to do around this area. One can walk over to the the Museum, Tahrir Square, Nasr Metro Station, Bo Bus station or the Nile in about 10 minutes. My room was surprisingly quiet considering the busy location! The railway station is about 1km away. Countless shopping and food options in the neighborhood - from touristy to very local stuff!  The general vibe at the hotel is very welcoming, laid back and casual. They serve breakfast and even offered to customize it for me. There's a shared kitchen and plenty of seating in the lobby. The wifi is not the best, though it was being hogged by a few guests streaming videos all day. I found an unused wifi router in the hallway and set it up as a range extender. The hosts were immensely grateful!  Made some great connections with the hosts and fellow travelers as I lounged about the lobby, sipping some of their amazing shaay :) Special mention for Ahmed - the dashing young man who drove me all around Cairo, Giza, dropped me to the train station and even invited me for a home-cooked meal! Mr. Omar and Ibrahim are ambassadors of Egyptian hospitality. They made me feel like a guest and not a customer. It was almost too good to be true! They actually convinced me to return to Egypt! I'll certainly stay again at Mr. Umar and Mr. Ibrahim's place…

name: Pyramids Loft Guesthouse
aminities: ,Free parking,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Internet,Horseback riding,Airport transportation,Baggage storage,Non-smoking hotel,Air conditioning,Desk,Iron,Wake-up service / alarm clock,Coffee / tea maker,Bath / shower,Hair dryer,Family rooms
location: 35 Abouelhoul St.,Nezlet Semman, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Our newly-renovated property, complete with dazzling rooftop patio, is located up the street from the magnificent pyramids. The property features cozy rooms and a breathtaking panoramic view of the pyramids. Come stay with us and experience the last remaining wonder of the ancient world. The Guest House offers communal spaces to socialize with fellow travelers from around the world, as well as private bathrooms on each floor. Enjoy a drink and a bite to eat while you soak up the unparalleled view of the Giza Plateau from our rooftop terrace. The combination of authentic Egyptian culture and international guests makes for a truly unique experience you will remember forever!

name: City Hostel
location: Ali Al Kasar Street, Cairo 29022 Egypt
description: The hotel is very centrally located, near Attaba metro station. It is very clean compared to what you find outside on the streets, so if you want your oasis of cleaness in Cairo, you have found it. The staff is very friendly, always helpful and welcoming. Mr. Robert will always check up with you to see if you are ok or need anything. Breakfast is basic but hearty. They will not be pushy to sell you any tours as other hotels do. They really care about the guests needs and even did the laundry for free without accepting any money for it. The housekeeping is sometimes too loud on the corridor early in the morning.

location: 21 Mohamed Mazhar St. Zamalek, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Set on the picturesque and exclusive island of Zamalek on the magnificent waters of the River Nile, the Hilton Zamalek Residence Cairo is located in a tranquil spot between downtown Cairo and Giza and is only 12 miles from Cairo Airport. All of the luxurious guest rooms at this hotel in Cairo offer spectacular city or river views and feature modern amenities such as high-speed internet access and LCD TVs. Upgrade to an elegant suite for additional space, a kitchen, living and dining areas and terraces offering scenic Nile views. Hold a professional conference in one of 3 flexible meeting rooms, all of which feature the latest in audio/visual technology and make use of our business center. Dine on international and oriental cuisine overlooking the pool and the River Nile in Nile Breeze, listen to live music in the Tea Time Lounge and enjoy casual al fresco food and drink on the deck at Waves. Work out in the complimentary Fitness Center, swim lengths in the heated swimming pool, which features a Jacuzzi or indulge in a massage while the little ones have fun in the Children’s Play Area. Explore the Egyptian Museum, experience the exotic sights, sounds and smells of the vibrant Egyptian Bazaar, 'Khan El-Khalili' and marvel at the Great Sphinx and Pyramids at Giza.

location: Nile City Towers - 2005 B, Corniche El Nil Ramlet Beaulac, Cairo 2466 Egypt
description: A melting pot of history and diversity, the city of Cairo is ideal for both business and leisure. Like the city itself, Fairmont Nile City offers a delightful series of contrasts, combining advanced technology and modern design with local flavors and flair. With sweeping panoramas of the river Nile and the Pyramids in the distance, Cairo’s beauty and history are always in sight from your luxury accommodation. During your stay, embark on culinary adventures at the city’s finest restaurants, enjoy the fresh air at our rooftop poolside restaurant and pamper yourself at Willow Stream Spa. Part of the prestigious Nile City complex, this luxury hotel is the perfect location for business events. The space consists of 845 square meters (9,100 square feet) plus 450 square meters (4,800 square feet) of outdoor space dedicated to meetings and conventions, comprising of 10 meeting rooms including a ballroom. The space also offers spectacular river Nile views.

name: Kmt Hostel
location: 8 Gawad Housny 3rd Floor, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: I chose KMT Hostel since I needed a cheap place to sleep for one night in Cairo.  It's well located - I walked there from the bus station.  There are restaurants nearby and the metro is close.   My bunk bed was comfortable and roomy, though I suspect the room gets crowded when all the beds are taken.  The bunk has a personal plug, light and a shelf.  Bathroom was clean with good showers.   I left early, so didn't try the breakfast.  The hotel owner was my taxi driver to the airport, very easy.  I wish there was an indoor lounge with no smoking allowed. FYI there is no outdoor space, which would be a pain for a longer visit.  Front desk staff seems hit or miss.

location: 3 El Thawra Council St Zamalek, Cairo Egypt
description: On the southern tip of Gezirah Island, the hotel is a corner of paradise in central Cairo, minutes from Cairo’s business districts. Discover a haven of peace during a vacation in Egypt, and a comfortable base to rest after a successful day of business. Relax by the pool, pamper yourself in Sofitel SPA, wine and dine in our international restaurants and bars. Surrender to luxury and come for a day, a weekend, a week…or more. A stroll along the hotel’s lush riverside promenade takes you to a host of acclaimed restaurants and bars. You can take your time, enjoying the cool shade of exotic palms and breathing in the scent of hibiscus. You’ll hear the gentle sound of water lapping as you rest on a Nile-side terrace with a cool drink, and dine on international cuisine. It’s especially beautiful at dusk, when the sun sets over Cairo’s skyline and vibrant nightlife. Escape the city for a day at our secluded Cairo hotel, which feels like an exclusive Egyptian resort set in lush gardens. Take advantage of Sofitel SPA and Sofitel FIT, float in an infinity pool overlooking the Nile, unwind in a bubbling whirlpool bath… whatever you desire. Day membership includes discounts to the restaurants and bars which line the Nile-side promenade, promising refreshment and fun for families, couples and friends.

name: Cairo International Hostel Downtown
location: 9 Adly 5th floor, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Commençons par les points positifs… ou plutôt l’unique point positif : la localisation en plein cœur du centre ville, idéal pour rayonner à pieds, voiture, ou métro. L’arrivée à « l’hôtel » se fait par l’une des artères principales du cente-ville, ou par une petite ruelle au charme « coupe-gorge », si vous arrivez du mauvais côté. Arrivés en bas du bâtiment, nous n’avons trouvé aucune indication/pancarte confirmant la présence de l’établissement, et c’est grâce aux avis laissés sur différents sites que nous nous sommes rendus au 5eme étage pour le check-in. Prenant possession de notre chambre, nous avons pu constater que les draps étaient sales (présence de nombreuses tâches et cheveux/poils de précédents occupants, Cf photos). Malgré tout, et fatigués d’une intense journée, nous nous sommes empressés d’aller nous coucher et avons immédiatement noté l’absence totale d’insonorisation, résultant en une charmante nuit blanche. Le centre-ville du Caire ressemble à un gigantesque cortège de mariage avec ses coups de klaxons incessants de 6h à 1h30, s’en suivent les aboiements des chiens errants de 1h30 à 4h30-5h et enfin l’appel à la prière. Autant dire si vous aspirez à passer une nuit paisible, un autre établissement avec un minimum d’insonorisation sera tout indiqué. Pour passer le temps durant ces nombreuses heures à tourner et retourner dans notre lit, nous avons été gratifiés de multiples démangeaisons ne laissant guère de doute sur leur origine : de belles piqûres en rang d’oignons témoignant de la présence de punaises de lit plutôt voraces. Si vous êtes malgré tout tentés de séjourner dans ce lieu immonde, assurez-vous que votre gabarit vous permette de profiter des toilettes sans vous cogner dans le mur se trouvant face à vous (idéal pour travailler un mouvement de squats bien vertical). Attention également aux bouteilles d’eau fournies par l’établissement qui sont en réalité des bouteilles de récupération remplies à la fontaine : si la tourista vous effraie, nous vous recommandons plutôt de vous approvisionner à l’épicerie située au bout de la petite ruelle précédemment évoquée. En résumé, à fuir ! Le tarif, même bas, ne suffit pas à occulter tous les aspects négatifs de ce lieu que je n’oserais qualifier d’hôtel, d’hostel ni même de refuge.…

name: Cairo House
location: 20 Adly, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: We faced a problem while accommodating that our room has been reserved twice even if i have received a confirmation from the property and they messaged me that i have to arrive before 6:00 pm. They say to us that no room available after our arrival and they will transfer us to another place with same price!!!

name: Columbia Hotel
location: 42 Talaat Harb, Cairo 11562 Egypt
description: The central location is positive.  The rest is negative. It's more like Airbnb with a reception on the 6th floor of a run-down building.  There is smoking at the reception, which you can smell in the front rooms. The furniture is yellowed, there are scratches on the wood.  Everything makes a loveless and unkempt impression.  Without ventilation, the rooms are fine. Even a window was broken. Breakfast only on demand and normally only from 9. Then it takes half an hour.  Who wants to leave early for the sights should wake up early and hope that e. g. a guy from the reception “feels able” to prepare some breakfast (which was always bread, cheese, foul, a salad that’s all).  Maybe it’s a place for a solo traveler man but not for someone with a western standard.

description: Modern serviced apartments for extended stays in dynamic Cairo Citystars. Offering the comfort and convenience of a home away from home, Staybridge Suites® Cairo Citystars has everything you need for independent living in the exciting commercial hub of Heliopolis. With direct access to Stars Centre shopping mall, and just a seven-minute drive from Cairo International Airport and Cairo International Convention and Exhibition Centre, our 140 fully furnished studios and suites place travelers where they need to be. The buzzing streets of downtown Cairo are half an hour away, with the Great Pyramids a little further. Business travelers on extended stays in Cairo can settle into a spacious studio or suite with up to three bedrooms. Full kitchens and living areas let you cook, work and entertain in style, and Wi-Fi is complimentary throughout. A free buffet breakfast sets you up for the day, and an Evening Social invites you to mingle with fellow guests over dinner three nights a week.

Or how to casually remove your freedom. We canceled our stay, they said they were going to refund us and then never did. Don't recommend it at all.

location: 2 Bostan Ibn Qurysh, Cairo 00202 Egypt
description: Avoid at all cost! I arrived late in the day only to find out that they did not have my pre-paid room available. Just hours before my arrival I had whatsapped them to make sure that everything is fine and they lied to me saying my room would be waiting for me. When I arrived, they said they have no room and would give me a room in a sister property which looked much worse. I asked them if they can organize a stay in a nicer hotel and they refused. Just to make sure: I had a confirmed reservation, just saying this again! Also, the lobby looks not even close to what they show online. Avoid at all cost.

location: Ali Rashed Street Heliopolis, Cairo 11757 Egypt
description: A modern, family-friendly hotel in Cairo's dynamic Citystars Heliopolis In the heart of Citystars business and leisure complex and just 10 minutes from Cairo International Airport, the Holiday Inn® Cairo Citystars hotel is an ideal base for exploring the modern and historic attractions of Egypt's capital. Next to the hotel, Stars Centre Mall is home to over 640 of shops and high-tech amusements including Snow City and Magic Galaxy, Egypt's largest indoor theme park. Downtown Cairo is less than half an hour away. The hotel's family-friendly atmosphere makes everyone feel at home, from the rooftop garden with its adults' and children's swimming pools, to the Star Corner Café in the lobby. Open 24-hours, Windows Restaurant tempts diners with heaped international buffets and live cooking stations, and Indira Restaurant serves some of the best Indian food in Cairo. Business travelers appreciate the fast, free Wi-Fi, business center and 24-hour room service. Need to hold a meeting?

name: Hotel Velvet 1889
location: 118 Mohammed Farid Street, Cairo 00202 Egypt
description: My stay at Velvet 1889 was the worst hotel stay of my life so far. The receptionist refused giving me bed covers and told me to turn the A/C on instead. It is February, and it's Cairo nights are incredibly chilly. When I contacted the customer service, they told me the same thing and the A/C would be more than enough! I felt completely humiliated and dehumanised. The bedsheets had body hairs stuck to them and the towel I was given was already wet. I had to cut my stay short and leave the hotel at 12 a.m. to go and look for somewhere else where I could even have the luxury of having blankets. When I came out of the room, I found that the receptionist was putting together bedsheets for me to use as make-do blankets. The experience was disappointing through and through. They did not even once apologize or show any vague understanding of human needs, such as having a warm place to sleep in in such a harsh winter!…

The property is around 2.1 km from The Egyptian Museum and 2.2 km from Cairo Tower. The property is 2.2 km from Khan Al Khalili. At the hostel, each room includes a terrace. The rooms come with a private bathroom. A continental breakfast is available daily at the property.

description: our stay at Sedna Al Hussein Hotel was beautiful as the staff were friendly and helpful , entire property and room were very clean , quite atmosphere , very good value for the price and above all is the location few steps to the old Bazaar ( Khan El Khalil ) the old Islamic style buildings are magical , We highly recommend it .

location: 21 Mohamed Mazhar St. Zamalek, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Set on the picturesque and exclusive island of Zamalek on the magnificent waters of the River Nile, the Hilton Zamalek Residence Cairo is located in a tranquil spot between downtown Cairo and Giza and is only 12 miles from Cairo Airport. All of the luxurious guest rooms at this hotel in Cairo offer spectacular city or river views and feature modern amenities such as high-speed internet access and LCD TVs. Upgrade to an elegant suite for additional space, a kitchen, living and dining areas and terraces offering scenic Nile views. Hold a professional conference in one of 3 flexible meeting rooms, all of which feature the latest in audio/visual technology and make use of our business center. Dine on international and oriental cuisine overlooking the pool and the River Nile in Nile Breeze, listen to live music in the Tea Time Lounge and enjoy casual al fresco food and drink on the deck at Waves. Work out in the complimentary Fitness Center, swim lengths in the heated swimming pool, which features a Jacuzzi or indulge in a massage while the little ones have fun in the Children’s Play Area. Explore the Egyptian Museum, experience the exotic sights, sounds and smells of the vibrant Egyptian Bazaar, 'Khan El-Khalili' and marvel at the Great Sphinx and Pyramids at Giza.

description: A melting pot of history and diversity, the city of Cairo is ideal for both business and leisure. Like the city itself, Fairmont Nile City offers a delightful series of contrasts, combining advanced technology and modern design with local flavors and flair. With sweeping panoramas of the river Nile and the Pyramids in the distance, Cairo’s beauty and history are always in sight from your luxury accommodation. During your stay, embark on culinary adventures at the city’s finest restaurants, enjoy the fresh air at our rooftop poolside restaurant and pamper yourself at Willow Stream Spa. Part of the prestigious Nile City complex, this luxury hotel is the perfect location for business events. The space consists of 845 square meters (9,100 square feet) plus 450 square meters (4,800 square feet) of outdoor space dedicated to meetings and conventions, comprising of 10 meeting rooms including a ballroom. The space also offers spectacular river Nile views.

location: 3 El Thawra Council St Zamalek, Cairo Egypt
description: On the southern tip of Gezirah Island, the hotel is a corner of paradise in central Cairo, minutes from Cairo’s business districts. Discover a haven of peace during a vacation in Egypt, and a comfortable base to rest after a successful day of business. Relax by the pool, pamper yourself in Sofitel SPA, wine and dine in our international restaurants and bars. Surrender to luxury and come for a day, a weekend, a week…or more. A stroll along the hotel’s lush riverside promenade takes you to a host of acclaimed restaurants and bars. You can take your time, enjoying the cool shade of exotic palms and breathing in the scent of hibiscus. You’ll hear the gentle sound of water lapping as you rest on a Nile-side terrace with a cool drink, and dine on international cuisine. It’s especially beautiful at dusk, when the sun sets over Cairo’s skyline and vibrant nightlife. Escape the city for a day at our secluded Cairo hotel, which feels like an exclusive Egyptian resort set in lush gardens. Take advantage of Sofitel SPA and Sofitel FIT, float in an infinity pool overlooking the Nile, unwind in a bubbling whirlpool bath… whatever you desire. Day membership includes discounts to the restaurants and bars which line the Nile-side promenade, promising refreshment and fun for families, couples and friends.

description: Modern serviced apartments for extended stays in dynamic Cairo Citystars. Offering the comfort and convenience of a home away from home, Staybridge Suites® Cairo Citystars has everything you need for independent living in the exciting commercial hub of Heliopolis. With direct access to Stars Centre shopping mall, and just a seven-minute drive from Cairo International Airport and Cairo International Convention and Exhibition Centre, our 140 fully furnished studios and suites place travelers where they need to be. The buzzing streets of downtown Cairo are half an hour away, with the Great Pyramids a little further. Business travelers on extended stays in Cairo can settle into a spacious studio or suite with up to three bedrooms. Full kitchens and living areas let you cook, work and entertain in style, and Wi-Fi is complimentary throughout. A free buffet breakfast sets you up for the day, and an Evening Social invites you to mingle with fellow guests over dinner three nights a week.

description: Looking for a place to stay in Cairo? Then look no further than Nour Elsabah Hotel, an inn that brings the best of Cairo to your doorstep.Guest rooms offer amenities such as a sofa, and guests can go online with free wifi offered by the inn.Nour Elsabah Hotel features 24 hour front desk, outdoor furniture, and a gift shop, to help make your stay more enjoyable. The property also boasts an on-site restaurant.While staying at Nour Elsabah Hotel, visitors can check out Mohamed Ali Mosque (1.2 mi) and Islamic Cairo (1.3 mi), some of Cairo's top attractions.While in Cairo, you may want to check out some of the restaurants that are a short walk away from Nour Elsabah Hotel, including Naguib Mahfouz Cafe (0.1 mi), El Fishawi (0.0 mi), and On The Run (1.2 mi).If you’re looking for something to do, Al-Azhar Park (0.5 mi), Citadel (Al-Qalaa) (0.8 mi), and Mosque of Al-Azhar (1.0 mi) are a nice way to spend some time, and they are all within walking distance of Nour Elsabah Hotel.We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Nour Elsabah Hotel as you experience everything Cairo has to offer.

description: A modern, family-friendly hotel in Cairo's dynamic Citystars Heliopolis In the heart of Citystars business and leisure complex and just 10 minutes from Cairo International Airport, the Holiday Inn® Cairo Citystars hotel is an ideal base for exploring the modern and historic attractions of Egypt's capital. Next to the hotel, Stars Centre Mall is home to over 640 of shops and high-tech amusements including Snow City and Magic Galaxy, Egypt's largest indoor theme park. Downtown Cairo is less than half an hour away. The hotel's family-friendly atmosphere makes everyone feel at home, from the rooftop garden with its adults' and children's swimming pools, to the Star Corner Café in the lobby. Open 24-hours, Windows Restaurant tempts diners with heaped international buffets and live cooking stations, and Indira Restaurant serves some of the best Indian food in Cairo. Business travelers appreciate the fast, free Wi-Fi, business center and 24-hour room service. Need to hold a meeting?

description: An old sheikh once said "Service without love is like a beautiful corpse. The outer form is lovely, but it is lifeless" We believe that service is a form of worship and also a powerful method of self-transformation.. By service the Sufis mean service for Gods sake" without any thoughts of rewards but out of love and graduate.. This is the kind of service we offer and provide and that is the way we follow at Sufi house hostel. A little bit about Sufi House Hostel: Our 24-hour welcome and information desk is always there to help with any questions. In addition, guests can get information on what to visit in the city and how to get there safely and securely. Or if this is your first time visiting Cairo, our daily guided tours and activities provide a friendly and accessible introduction to everything Cairo has to offer, from local concerts in Cairo to the great pyramids of Egypt. For your comfort, coffee/tea in a common area, laundry facilities are available at this property.

location: 41 Sherif Basha, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: This hotel was a discovery for me! I originally booked a neighbor hotel, but when I arrived there at 3:00 AM they told me they were overbooked and had no room for me. Richmond House was the closed one, so I popped up without a reservation and the manager on reception was more than helpful. He only had one room available for just one night, so he let me take it with a good rate. He advised me to check again next day, and luckily they had a cancellation, so I continued my stay in another room.  Both rooms were clean, nicely furnished in a traditional style. Beds were very comfortable. Hot water was always available. Cleaning lady was doing a great job. All staff I met were super friendly and went out of their way to assist.  The location is convenient. If you walk out from the building, you will find many places to eat - from street vendors and fast food chain (KFC is 5 minutes walk) to decent restaurants. Tahrir Square and Egyptian Museum are around 15 minutes walk.  I definitely recommend this hotel for a budget stay!…

description: Looking for a place to stay in Cairo? Then look no further than Town View Hotel, a budget friendly small hotel that brings the best of Cairo to your doorstep.You’ll enjoy relaxing rooms that offer a minibar, air conditioning, and a mosquito net, and you can stay connected during your stay as Town View Hotel offers guests free internet access.The small hotel features 24 hour front desk, room service, and a concierge. Plus, Town View Hotel offers a lounge, providing a pleasant respite from your busy day. For guests with a vehicle, there is paid private parking available on-site.Given the close proximity of popular landmarks, such as Cave Church (1.3 mi) and Citadel (Al-Qalaa) (1.4 mi), guests of Town View Hotel can easily experience some of Cairo's most well known attractions.While visiting Cairo, you may want to try some gyros at one of the nearby restaurants, such as The Greek.If you’re looking for something to do, Mohamed Ali Mosque (0.7 mi), Islamic Cairo (0.9 mi), and Gayer-Anderson Museum (Bayt al-Kiritliya) (0.8 mi) are a nice way to spend some time, and they are all within walking distance of Town View Hotel.We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Town View Hotel as you experience everything Cairo has to offer.

location: 3 El Thawra Council St Zamalek, Cairo Egypt
description: On the southern tip of Gezirah Island, the hotel is a corner of paradise in central Cairo, minutes from Cairo’s business districts. Discover a haven of peace during a vacation in Egypt, and a comfortable base to rest after a successful day of business. Relax by the pool, pamper yourself in Sofitel SPA, wine and dine in our international restaurants and bars. Surrender to luxury and come for a day, a weekend, a week…or more. A stroll along the hotel’s lush riverside promenade takes you to a host of acclaimed restaurants and bars. You can take your time, enjoying the cool shade of exotic palms and breathing in the scent of hibiscus. You’ll hear the gentle sound of water lapping as you rest on a Nile-side terrace with a cool drink, and dine on international cuisine. It’s especially beautiful at dusk, when the sun sets over Cairo’s skyline and vibrant nightlife. Escape the city for a day at our secluded Cairo hotel, which feels like an exclusive Egyptian resort set in lush gardens. Take advantage of Sofitel SPA and Sofitel FIT, float in an infinity pool overlooking the Nile, unwind in a bubbling whirlpool bath… whatever you desire. Day membership includes discounts to the restaurants and bars which line the Nile-side promenade, promising refreshment and fun for families, couples and friends.

aminities: ,Parking,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Fitness Centre with Gym / Workout Room,Free breakfast,Kids stay free,Babysitting,Car hire,Business Centre with Internet Access,Wifi,Restaurant,Breakfast available,Breakfast buffet,Breakfast in the room,Meeting rooms,Baggage storage,Concierge,Convenience store,Currency exchange,Non-smoking hotel,Shops,24-hour front desk,Dry cleaning,Laundry service,Self-serve laundry,Air conditioning,Housekeeping,Kitchenette,Microwave,Refrigerator,Flatscreen TV,Non-smoking rooms,Suites,Family rooms
location: Emtedad Makram Obied Street Heliopolis, Cairo 11737 Egypt
description: Modern serviced apartments for extended stays in dynamic Cairo Citystars. Offering the comfort and convenience of a home away from home, Staybridge Suites® Cairo Citystars has everything you need for independent living in the exciting commercial hub of Heliopolis. With direct access to Stars Centre shopping mall, and just a seven-minute drive from Cairo International Airport and Cairo International Convention and Exhibition Centre, our 140 fully furnished studios and suites place travelers where they need to be. The buzzing streets of downtown Cairo are half an hour away, with the Great Pyramids a little further. Business travelers on extended stays in Cairo can settle into a spacious studio or suite with up to three bedrooms. Full kitchens and living areas let you cook, work and entertain in style, and Wi-Fi is complimentary throughout. A free buffet breakfast sets you up for the day, and an Evening Social invites you to mingle with fellow guests over dinner three nights a week.

name: Sun Smile Hotel
location: 133 Omar Ibn El Khattab St. Heliopolis, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Такого ужаса я еще не видела. Когда мы приехали было темно, особо не разглядела. Но с утра начался кошмар. Убирают в отеле отвратительно. Кормят так же как и убирают. На второй день я отравилась рыбой. Оказывается ее подали, она была уже испорченной. Два для я обнимала унитаз. После это я есть в местном ресторане не могла. На территории отеля есть русский ресторанчик, который меня и спас. Потому что оставшийся отпуск я питалась за свои деньги там. Анимация ужасная. Через пяти минут я ушла спать. За территорией отеля обстановка не очень, грязно, мусор, брошенная стройка. Из отеля лучше не выходить. Персонал отвратительный.

The hotel has 25 rooms with A/C, Bathroom, Satellite TV, telephone, and some of which overlook the river Nile. Food is freshly prepared by or chefs. aminities: ,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Wifi,Restaurant,Business Centre with Internet Access,Non-smoking hotel,Laundry service,Air conditioning,Room service,Non-smoking rooms

description: If you’re looking for a luxury hotel in Cairo, look no further than Cosmopolitan Hotel.Given the close proximity to Khan Al-Khalili (1.9 mi), guests of Cosmopolitan Hotel can easily experience one of Cairo's most popular landmarks.You’ll enjoy relaxing rooms that offer air conditioning, and you can stay connected during your stay as Cosmopolitan Hotel Cairo offers guests free wifi.The hotel features room service. Plus, Cosmopolitan Hotel Cairo offers an on-site restaurant, providing a pleasant respite from your busy day.While in Cairo, you may want to check out some of the restaurants that are a short walk away from Cosmopolitan Hotel Cairo, including O.Liv.O Pizzeria & Bar (1.2 mi), Blackstone Bistro (1.0 mi), and Le Peking Zamalek (0.6 mi).Cairo is also known for some great art museums, including Gayer-Anderson Museum (Bayt al-Kiritliya), Museum of Islamic Arts, and Museum of Islamic Ceramics, which are not too far from Cosmopolitan Hotel Cairo.The staff at Cosmopolitan Hotel looks forward to serving you during your upcoming visit.

name: Nile Villa Hotel
location: 8 8 Abd El-Aal Helmy Basha, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: La struttura è un vero e proprio hotel ( non come altri che occupano solo dei piani di alcuni edifici) e ha una bella terrazza per le colazioni proprio sul Nilo. La camera era abbastanza spaziosa con due letti comodi (col piumino imbottito). Non aveva balcone ma 2 finestre vista fiume. La posizione è  abbastanza vicina al centro ma fuori dal traffico quindi, tranne per un pochino di rumore dell'aria condizionata si dorme benissimo.  Il bagno è rifatto da poco, quindi moderno anche se con qualche piccola pecca. Forniscono solo il sapone ma danno le ciabattine. La colazione viene servita in una terrazzina proprio sul fiume, con tanto di ventilatore. E' una colazione egiziana solo salata con dei falafel e le omelette cotte al momento, formaggio, verdure, pane egiziano e the o caffè. Il personale è stato molto gentile, ci hanno accolto a notte fonda e l'autista che è venuto a prenderci all'aeroporto ( per 18 euro) è stato molto cordiale con un'ottima guida. Zona tranquilla. Certamente ci vuole un po' di spirito di adattamento, perchè la pulizia non è proprio agli standard che ci si aspetta e alcuni mobili sono un po' malandati (o coperti di cellophane, non so perchè!) ma in generale per il prezzo che ha ritengo sia una buona scelta di fascia  economica.…

description: Five Stars Hotel Located in Cairo, Egypt. Tolip Hotel Gardens resides near the Cairo Suez Road, right in the heart of the Gardenia Compound. The hotel stands a mere 10 minutes away from the Cairo International Airport.

name: Columbia Hotel
location: 42 Talaat Harb, Cairo 11562 Egypt
description: The central location is positive.  The rest is negative. It's more like Airbnb with a reception on the 6th floor of a run-down building.  There is smoking at the reception, which you can smell in the front rooms. The furniture is yellowed, there are scratches on the wood.  Everything makes a loveless and unkempt impression.  Without ventilation, the rooms are fine. Even a window was broken. Breakfast only on demand and normally only from 9. Then it takes half an hour.  Who wants to leave early for the sights should wake up early and hope that e. g. a guy from the reception “feels able” to prepare some breakfast (which was always bread, cheese, foul, a salad that’s all).  Maybe it’s a place for a solo traveler man but not for someone with a western standard.

The hotel's family-friendly atmosphere makes everyone feel at home, from the rooftop garden with its adults' and children's swimming pools, to the Star Corner Café in the lobby. location: 21 Mohamed Mazhar St. Zamalek, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Set on the picturesque and exclusive island of Zamalek on the magnificent waters of the River Nile, the Hilton Zamalek Residence Cairo is located in a tranquil spot between downtown Cairo and Giza and is only 12 miles from Cairo Airport. All of the luxurious guest rooms at this hotel in Cairo offer spectacular city or river views and feature modern amenities such as high-speed internet access and LCD TVs. Upgrade to an elegant suite for additional space, a kitchen, living and dining areas and terraces offering scenic Nile views. Hold a professional conference in one of 3 flexible meeting rooms, all of which feature the latest in audio/visual technology and make use of our business center. Dine on international and oriental cuisine overlooking the pool and the River Nile in Nile Breeze, listen to live music in the Tea Time Lounge and enjoy casual al fresco food and drink on the deck at Waves. Work out in the complimentary Fitness Center, swim lengths in the heated swimming pool, which features a Jacuzzi or indulge in a massage while the little ones have fun in the Children’s Play Area. Explore the Egyptian Museum, experience the exotic sights, sounds and smells of the vibrant Egyptian Bazaar, 'Khan El-Khalili' and marvel at the Great Sphinx and Pyramids at Giza.

name: Ultra Trans Hotel
location: Nile Corniche, Shubra Al Kheimah In front of Mohamed Ali Palace, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: We have chosen this hotel because in order to be in Shobra and also because of the perfect view from the rooms. There is terrace facing the Nile River directly. Unforgettable atmosphere for drinking coffee in the morning or having lunch in the afternoon. Breakfast is fine, every day the same, but you can choose for yourself whatever you want.  Room is comfortable, clean, spacious. It was not cold beside the Nile during our stay. They provide water and coffee/tea facilities in the room.   The territory is not big and it is actually not for walking or staying whole day. There are swimming pools (we did not use), bars in open area. Parking is free and located underground.  They provide food to the room by the menu - prices are affordable like at any normal restaurant outside.   In general - good hotel to stay if you need to be in this area and plan to spend whole day outside the hotel.…

Tahrir Square, Mogamaa (Visa services). Lo

name: Horizon Nile Plaza Hotel
location: 67 Abdulaziz Al Saud Al Manial, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Horizon Nile Plaza Hotel is maybe not easy to find, because it within a skyscraper, but once you are in the room, we got more than expected. The rooms are very clean and spaces, and the view over Cairo is really nice. Also, the breakfast, which is served on the room, is a nice Egyptian breakfast, which is alright. Near by the hotel you find some nice restaurants, so no need for a long walk or ride. Also, a small supermarket is round the corner. All in all, we a good hotel especially on a value for money ratio, we would definitely come again.  Room service was not existent, so they didn´t clean the rooms during our whole stay (7 nights). Thank god we brought shower gel, as well as a hairdryer. As usual in that city, the rooms a bit noisy. If you have rooms to the east side, there are mosques quite close, the north and west side are better.…

name: Green Garden Inn
location: 1086 Nile Corniche, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: The Green Garden Inn rescued us after a horrible experience where we had arrived in Cairo - at night, in the dark, with children - to discover that our hotel booked through Booking.com was full and couldn't offer us a room.  The Green Garden Inn staff were absolutely fantastic - so friendly, helpful, smiley and kind.  Our kids had a great time watching the football in the Reception.  Breakfast was very good - lots of choice.  The hotel is located in a quiet, safe area - 15 minute walk from Tahir Square where there are lots of restaurants.  Would highly recommend.

I recommend these accommodations and I would happily retain back to Tuhfa appartments when I go back to Cairo. Fakhri Al-Khabass

name: Oxford Hotel & Restaurant
location: El Sabah tower, ibrahim Nagib street Garden City, Cairo 11519 Egypt
description: 1 is just too much for this hotel. Dirty, loud and just awful. The rooms was too dirty and the night you could not sleep with such a noise and the breakfast was sad, just sad. It was an omelet and 3 very testy breads and that’s all. The entry of the hotel was very bad also

name: Grand Nile Royal Hotel at Nile Plaza
location: 1085 Corniche El-Nile - Garden City, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: The hotel is close to the center and you are able to walk in 15-20 min to Egyptian museum and some other attractions. The rooms were clea and relaxing. We were close to reception and Internet connection worked well during the time we were in.  The staff was lovely at reception and the breakfast was amazing as well (it looked pretty simple at first sight, but then we discovered the fresh omelet and other things. You get a kettle in the room and a few tea bags, but no bottles water like in other places around the country.  There is a car park on the premises, but is hard to locate it when first arriving, so we ended up in a local car park by the buildings near by.  Depending on the floor your stay, you might have a different view of the Nille. The great part is that you have a close balcony were you can stay and relax watching the craziness of the city.…

description: This is a 2 Star hotel. It’s located in Giza which is suppose to be a nice area of Cairo. While the staff are friendly and helpful the place is very noisey, the beds are hard as rocks and the showers don’t have much water pressure and that’s if you can get hot water at all. I stayed here as a part of a basic tour booking so I suppose I got what I paid for - $46AUD per night. I was here three times throughout the tour and each room had the same issues. It is close to a pharmacy and some local clean restaurants and if you are only staying a night or two it would be ok, any longer and I’d recommend something a bit better.

In addition, as a valued Oasis Hotel guest, you can enjoy a pool and free breakfast that are available on-site. Guests arriving by vehicle have access to free parking.While staying at Oasis Hotel, visitors can check out Keops Pyramid (3.1 mi), which is a popular Cairo attraction.During your visit, be sure to check out popular art galleries like Sami Amin, Picasso Art Gallery Egypt, and Zamalek Art Gallery, which are all a short distance from the hotel.Oasis Hotel puts the best of Cairo at your fingertips, making your stay both relaxing and enjoyable.

name: Regency Hotel
aminities: ,Children Activities (Kid / Family Friendly)
location: 3 Abdel Azim Rashed St., Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: The Regency Hotel in Cairo is located in the Giza suburb of Dokki a fair walk from downtown Cairo on the west bank of the Nile, aka the crappy side. It is off a busy highway & around the corner from a ladies club. If this doesnt raise your suspicions about this being the wrong Regency Hotel perhaps the hand painted hotel sign will.  Room 506 has seen better days about a decade ago. After enjoying the release of emptying my bowels the toilet wouldnt flush & there wasnt any toilet paper. There was a 28cm tv, mini fridge & aircon. Bedsheets looked sort of gungy & the carpet was fairly dirty. The reception dudes spoke little english but knew how to ask for tips. I played a game of charades with them to try & explain the toilet problem. It was very entertaining, we eventually changed rooms to an equally poor room.  The hotel is housed in the sort of neighbourhood you would go to if you were homeless. Stray dogs & garbage are the main features here if you like to take photos. There are no computers in the hotel, the reception desk used paper & pen! The 80's has come back in fashion here.  The hotel resturant has cobbwebs on the locked door, this is probably not good so avoid even asking for food, just call KFC for takeaway 19019.  The previous review from 2 years ago basically describes our experience word for word, so in 2 years nothing had improved, indeed its pretty shabby. If you stayed here, have a sense of humour & laugh.…

description: Loin des standards d'un 1* encore moins d'un 5*  Pour avoir séjourné dans différents hôtels à travers le monde, je peux vous dire qu'ils doivent tout apprendre dans ce domaine.  Le personnel n'est pas du tout souriant et très peu aimable. Très loin de l'hospitalité africaine. L'accueil est inexistant.   Première fois en 15 ans que je tombe sur un hôtel aussi médiocre.  Scandaleux et honteux de mettre des descriptions non conformes.  1/ À quelques heures de s'enregistrer (une fois que l'annulation n'est plus possible) on reçoit un mail pour nous signaler que l'hôtel n'est réservé qu'aux égyptiens et que les nourritures et boissons extérieures sont complètement interdites dans l'enceinte. Aucuns de ces points n'aient signalés lors de la réservation ou sur le descriptif en ligne.  2/ Surprise au moment de s'enregistrer, le prix bloqué à la réservation à augmenté de 15% et l'hôtesse nous apprend qu'on doit ajouter 60$ à ce prix car nous sommes non résidents égyptiens.  DES VOLEURS!!   Face à notre refus d'ajouter autant elle baisse la somme de 70% en quelques secondes (taxe à la tête du client!!! Honteux !  3/ Ils proposent soit disant des chambres doubles mais au moment de découvrir la chambre on s'aperçoit qu'elle est avec 2 lits simples, on appelle l'accueil pour signaler que ce n'est pas ce que nous avions réservés. L'hôtesse nous répond simplement que dans cet hôtel toutes les chambres sont en lits séparés.   4/ La chambre est sommaire.   Odeur d'humidité et marque d'humidité sur les murs   Quant à la literie, elle n'est pas du tout confortable.  Juste une serviette de toilette, pas de serviettes pour les mains, cheveux ou même de tapis de bain... Pas de câble TV, uniquement les chaînes locales...  5/ Petit déjeuner inexistant,   même pas de café ou de lait, juste une bouilloire d'eau chaude, obligé d'aller se restaurer à côté pour avoir quelques choses de convenable à se mettre sous la dent. Déplorable  6/ Piscine non accessible à convenance car utiliser pour des entraînements  Enfin, vous l'aurez compris et êtes prévenus, à fuir !…

description: A melting pot of history and diversity, the city of Cairo is ideal for both business and leisure. Like the city itself, Fairmont Nile City offers a delightful series of contrasts, combining advanced technology and modern design with local flavors and flair. With sweeping panoramas of the river Nile and the Pyramids in the distance, Cairo’s beauty and history are always in sight from your luxury accommodation. During your stay, embark on culinary adventures at the city’s finest restaurants, enjoy the fresh air at our rooftop poolside restaurant and pamper yourself at Willow Stream Spa. Part of the prestigious Nile City complex, this luxury hotel is the perfect location for business events. The space consists of 845 square meters (9,100 square feet) plus 450 square meters (4,800 square feet) of outdoor space dedicated to meetings and conventions, comprising of 10 meeting rooms including a ballroom. The space also offers spectacular river Nile views.

description: Blue Bird Hotel Cairo got new owners in the end of 2014 and we have turned it into a cheap and cosy small boutique hotel where each room has its own vibe. The place is very good value for money and is known for its cleanliness and excellent customer service. All our focus is on helping our guests in every possible way, from places to visit, tours to go on, choice of transportation, help with laundry etc. We are on top of an antique building situated in Downtown in the heart of Cairo. Just 400 meters from the famous Talat Harb Square and only 5 minutes away from the historical Egyptian museum and major metro and train stations. Continental breakfast is included in the price. All rooms come with free wi-fi, air-con and television. Shared or private bathroom is to be chosen by the guest. You can choose between single rooms, double rooms (2 single beds or double bed) and triple rooms. Some rooms have balcony and all of them are non-smoking rooms. The daily staff speaks English and Egyptian, while the management speaks English, Egyptian, German,

location: 37 Kasr Al Nile Down Town, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Located at the top of a multipurpose building it’s not what you might expect from an Inn. The entrance is somewhat hidden in an alley. The entrance hall is, say the least, weird. The elevator will not pass any European security check, but remember you’re in Egypt. Their many gods will probably protect your journey up to the actual Inn, where an informal welcome awaits you. Your host Khaled and his twin sister will show you every courtesy one could expect. Your wish is his / their command. Like a real Egyptian genie he will bring you at the most impossible of hours a cool forbidden drink combined with the latest gossip about his vast family. Charming, entertaining, it makes you feel at home. Our room was clean and decorated Egyptian style. The bathroom was the same, however, Egyptian style in case refers to the way it was constructed. It all worked but a sense of humor was needed. In short, a nice, hospitable place with limits for a short stay at the city centre, close to King Tut. Service with a wonderful smile.…

description: Hotel is located on one floor of a renovated old building.  A bit tired-looking, but with a lot of the original charm and art deco style.  The location is near the Metro and Khan Al-Khalil bazaar, and not far from the Egyptian Museum.  The immediate neighborhood is interesting to walk in, but not many restaurants nearby.  The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, and we arranged a tour of the pyramids through them (which was excellent).  They can arrange all sorts of tours, including overnights to other Egyptian cities, and the prices were comparable to what we found online.  The shower was decent, with hot water.  Wifi was just ok, but from reading other reviews, Wifi in Cairo isn't generally great.

aminities: ,Free parking,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Free breakfast,Airport transportation,Baggage storage,Currency exchange,24-hour front desk,Dry cleaning,Wifi,Breakfast in the room,Shuttle bus service,Car hire,Non-smoking hotel,Shared kitchen,Shared lounge / TV area,ATM on site,Laundry service,Ironing service,Air conditioning,Safe,Coffee / tea maker,Microwave,Bath / shower,Hair dryer,Family rooms
location: 34 Talaat Harb Street 2nd Floor., Cairo, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Fairly clean, very nice staff. The AC worked, internet was decent. As a solo female, I felt very safe. I also had no problems walking around alone in the neighbourhood. The location is good. There are many restaurants nearby. It’s very convenient for the old Egyptian museum. The hotel is quite small.   You can book activities through them. The Cairo activities were overpriced but delivered okay services. I booked the Nile dinner cruise in Cairo, a Giza pyramid tour and a 4 day Aswan/Luxor cruise.The guides were not always very thorough and I never knew what was coming next.   DO NOT book Aswan/Luxor activities through them.  I paid almost double what other people on the cruise paid(use visitor it was legit and a good price). My guides were not great and they were frequently trying to scam me. They didn’t provide tour guides at more than 3 temples where I had thought I had paid for them. They didn’t tell me in advance so I wasn’t able to make alternative arrangements.   If you are looking for a cheap, safe, no frills place to hang out in Cairo, then it’s good. If you are looking for a hotel to help you book activities, I would recommend spending the money on a reputable hotel with dedicated staff for tours or finding a tour agency. Other people on my cruise booked it through the boat or website and paid half the price and got twice as much.…

The apartment comes fully fitted with all amenities except washing machine. The host Ahmed is really nice and super reactive, if you have any issues he will be there to help day or night. Only point i had flagged during my stay were some internet connection issues which was solved after 2 days and a bit more cleanliness of the apartment before handing over to the guest ( properly vacuuming and  changing the bedsheets and towels). description: A melting pot of history and diversity, the city of Cairo is ideal for both business and leisure. Like the city itself, Fairmont Nile City offers a delightful series of contrasts, combining advanced technology and modern design with local flavors and flair. With sweeping panoramas of the river Nile and the Pyramids in the distance, Cairo’s beauty and history are always in sight from your luxury accommodation. During your stay, embark on culinary adventures at the city’s finest restaurants, enjoy the fresh air at our rooftop poolside restaurant and pamper yourself at Willow Stream Spa. Part of the prestigious Nile City complex, this luxury hotel is the perfect location for business events. The space consists of 845 square meters (9,100 square feet) plus 450 square meters (4,800 square feet) of outdoor space dedicated to meetings and conventions, comprising of 10 meeting rooms including a ballroom. The space also offers spectacular river Nile views.

name: Blue Lotus Guesthouse
description: So we came here for late lunch.  We loved the food. It was fresh authentic cuisine at its finest. I am a chef and I don’t pick bones about food. This is by far the best meal I have had in a long time. If I could get delicious food like this in NYC I’d never leave. But this is so delicious if she opened a restaurant in NYC she would be a 5 star restaurant for sure. The dishes were prepared with accuracy and precision. The son was extremely nice and friendly. Our hostess was very humble.  The beverages were fresh squeezed while we ate.  If you have the chance venture to this gem for a meal. I am glad our tour guide from  DJEDEGYPT.COM picked out this place. Food was so good I’ll have it on my palate with my taste buds craving the delights.

Breakfast starts at 07:00 but it is also possible to arrange it much earlier in case you need to catch a flight. This hotel offers possibilities to use its balcony with a nice view over a part of Zamalek. Next to this hotel there is both a big supermarket (Sunny) and a place to eat, Rooms are cleaned every day and people at this hotel make sure you have a good stay and it is suitable for families as well.

location: Nile City Towers - 2005 B, Corniche El Nil Ramlet Beaulac, Cairo 2466 Egypt
description: A melting pot of history and diversity, the city of Cairo is ideal for both business and leisure. Like the city itself, Fairmont Nile City offers a delightful series of contrasts, combining advanced technology and modern design with local flavors and flair. With sweeping panoramas of the river Nile and the Pyramids in the distance, Cairo’s beauty and history are always in sight from your luxury accommodation. During your stay, embark on culinary adventures at the city’s finest restaurants, enjoy the fresh air at our rooftop poolside restaurant and pamper yourself at Willow Stream Spa. Part of the prestigious Nile City complex, this luxury hotel is the perfect location for business events. The space consists of 845 square meters (9,100 square feet) plus 450 square meters (4,800 square feet) of outdoor space dedicated to meetings and conventions, comprising of 10 meeting rooms including a ballroom. The space also offers spectacular river Nile views.

name: Cairo Palace
aminities: ,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Wifi,Airport transportation,Concierge,Non-smoking hotel,Dry cleaning,Laundry service,Air conditioning,Room service,Non-smoking rooms,Family rooms
location: 5 Imad El Din, Cairo 12421 Egypt
description: Welcome to Cairo Palace, your Cairo “home away from home.” Cairo Palace aims to make your visit as relaxing and enjoyable as possible, which is why so many guests continue to come back year after year.Given the close proximity of popular landmarks, such as Mosque of Al-Azhar (0.6 mi) and Cairo Tower (1.3 mi), guests of Cairo Palace can easily experience some of Cairo's most well known attractions.Cairo Palace is a charming small hotel offering air conditioning in the rooms, and it is easy to stay connected during your stay as free wifi is offered to guests.The small hotel features room service and a concierge.Travellers looking to enjoy some shrimp can head to Kadoura Fish Restaurant, Birdcage, or Abou el-Sid. Otherwise, you may want to check out a French restaurant such as The Revolving Restaurant, Le Deck, or The Grill Restaurant & Lounge.If you’re looking for something to do, Citadel (Al-Qalaa) (1.1 mi) and Zamalek (Gezira Island) (1.2 mi) are a nice way to spend some time, and they are all within walking distance of Cairo Palace.Cairo Palace puts the best of Cairo at your fingertips, making your stay both relaxing and enjoyable.

name: Navy Hotel - Kased Khair
aminities: ,Restaurant,Children Activities (Kid / Family Friendly),Laundry service
location: 4 Magles Qeyadet El Thawra St. El Gezirah, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: I have been the this hotel for many times.  Everything is more than perfect and reasonable in this place. The most important thing is the amazing view for all the rooms. The food is nice. The people are very respectful. If you are not looking for a luxurious place, it’s Avery nice reasonable one in every aspect.

name: Nile Houseboat B&B
aminities: ,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Wifi,Free breakfast,Kitchenette,Suites
description: Imagine waking up in Cairo on a houseboat and having breakfast on your balcony overlooking the great river Nile! We can offer you a unique accommodation while you are staying in Cairo, whether you are in town for business or pleasure. Nile Houseboat B&B is centrally located, just minutes from downtown Cairo. Your hosts - Dan Hallett and Mia Grondahl - have stayed twelve years on the houseboat and have decades of experience from living in the Middle East. They are ready to share their knowledge to make your stay in Egypt most memorable

name: Kirotel
aminities: ,Wifi,Airport transportation,Laundry service,Air conditioning,Room service
location: 9 Eltawen Street Downtown, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Everyone needs a place to lay their weary head. For travellers visiting Cairo, Kirotel is an excellent choice for rest and rejuvenation. Well-known for its romantic environment and proximity to great restaurants and attractions, Kirotel makes it easy to enjoy the best of Cairo.Rooms at Kirotel offer air conditioning providing exceptional comfort and convenience, and guests can go online with wifi.Room service is one of the conveniences offered at this small hotel.While staying at Kirotel, visitors can check out Church of St. Barbara (2.4 mi), which is a popular Cairo attraction.During your visit, be sure to check out one of the nearby restaurants that are within walking distance of Kirotel, such as Oiishi Sushi (1.1 mi), 7awary Texas (1.1 mi), or Mori Sushi (1.0 mi).If you are interested in exploring Cairo, check out a castle, such as Bab Zuweila.Kirotel is sure to make your visit to Cairo one worth remembering.

name: Diocesan Guest House
location: 5 Michele Lutfallah Street, Cairo Egypt
description: The stay was calm and comfortable. The staff was very friendly. We were picked from the airport since it was our first time. It's located near the Marriott Hotel, so it's easy for taxi drivers to find it. It is easy to navigate from there to reach other destinations. The room was clean.  April 2017

name: South Sinai Hotels
location: 79 El Merghany St. Floor 7 Heliopolis, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: الرحلات النيلية المتحركة لمدة 3 ساعات اجمل رحلة نيلية غداء او عشاء من افضل الرحلات داخل مصر التى تجذب السائحين اليها استمتع معنا برحلة ممتعة والاستمتاع بالمناظر الخلابة أثناء الغروب على أحدى البواخر النيلية المتحركة بالقاهرة ومشاهدة غروب الشمس على ضفاف النيل الساحر بجانب أنغام الموسيقى الشرقية افضل الفقرات الفنية الممتع وهي رقص شرقي وعروض التنورة بالاضافة الى فرقة فون شعبية شرقية ومطرب شعبي على البواخر النيلية المتحركة كورنيش المعادي من أفضل الأماكن السياحية فى القاهرة والجيزة

location: 4 Suk El Tawfikia, Cairo 11511 Egypt

name: Sky Executive Resort
description: The resort is amazing. The service is exceptional and the food is very good. name: Almokattam Homestay
location: Almokattam Elhadaba Elwosta, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Modernes,  stilvolles Hotel mit beeindruckendem Frühstücksbuffet (alles was das Herz begehrt mit höchster Qualität) und sehr gutem Preis-Leistungsverhältnis im Restaurant. Das gesamte Personal ist äußerst freundlich - ganz besonders jenes an der Rezeption. Die Zimmer sind gut ausgestattet und geräumig. Zwei Flaschen Wasser stehen kostenlos zur Verfügung. Einzig die Preise für alkoholische Getränke an der Bar sind überteuert.

description: budget accommodation in the center of Ramesis Sq. It is a small hotel run by a young and friendly staff. Guests can avail of our many facilities in our hotel in order to ensure a wonderful stay. Venus Hotel provides a variety of services for budget travelers and backpackers. It is the ideal choice for backpackers and budget travelers who wish to visit Cairo. The casual majlis (meeting room) off the lobby where breakfast is served makes a good place to hang out after a hot day's sightseeing. Helpful staff give guests plenty of advice about visiting Cairo and other parts of Egypt.

description: Located in the heart of Cairo, this hostel is 10 minutes’ walk from the Egyptian Museum and the Nile, 7-minute walk from the historic Tahrir Square. Also 5-minute on foot from Naguib metro station.

name: Cairo Heart Hotel
aminities: ,Free parking,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Coffee shop,Babysitting,Children Activities (Kid / Family Friendly),Airport transportation,Business Centre with Internet Access,24-hour security,Parking,Wifi,Restaurant,Breakfast available,Breakfast in the room,Vending machine,Shuttle bus service,Car hire,Taxi service,Baggage storage,Concierge,Convenience store,Currency exchange,Gift shop,ATM on site,Doorperson,24-hour check-in,24-hour front desk,Express check-in / check-out,Dry cleaning,Laundry service,Ironing service,Air conditioning,Housekeeping,Room service,Safe,Wake-up service / alarm clock,Kitchenette,Refrigerator,Hair dryer,Family rooms
location: 17 Bustan Street, Cairo 55101 Egypt
description: Cairo Heart Hotel is an excellent choice for travellers visiting Cairo, offering a budget friendly environment alongside many helpful amenities designed to enhance your stay.Rooms at Cairo Heart Hotel offer air conditioning, a kitchenette, and a refrigerator providing exceptional comfort and convenience, and guests can go online with free wifi.24 hour front desk, room service, and 24 hour check-in are some of the conveniences offered at this small hotel. Breakfast will also help to make your stay even more special. If you are driving to Cairo Heart Hotel, free parking is available.While staying at Cairo Heart Hotel, visitors can check out Mosque of Al-Azhar (0.4 mi) and Zamalek (Gezira Island) (0.6 mi), some of Cairo's top attractions.When you’re feeling hungry, be sure to check out The Revolving Restaurant, Le Deck, and The Grill Restaurant & Lounge, which are some French restaurants that are popular with locals and out-of-towners alike.If you’re looking for something to do, Cairo Tower (0.8 mi) and Citadel (Al-Qalaa) (1.0 mi) are a nice way to spend some time, and they are all within walking distance of Cairo Heart Hotel.Enjoy your stay in Cairo!

description: It doesn't matter if I've been away 1 year or 5 years from Egypt the friendly staff always remember me and welcome me back.  It has a great location right in downtown Cairo and they can assist with tours to all the attractions, including trips down to Luxor, Aswan and out into the White Desert.  Rooms are cheap and a light breakfast is included, I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

location: Nile City Towers - 2005 B, Corniche El Nil Ramlet Beaulac, Cairo 2466 Egypt
description: A melting pot of history and diversity, the city of Cairo is ideal for both business and leisure. Like the city itself, Fairmont Nile City offers a delightful series of contrasts, combining advanced technology and modern design with local flavors and flair. With sweeping panoramas of the river Nile and the Pyramids in the distance, Cairo’s beauty and history are always in sight from your luxury accommodation. During your stay, embark on culinary adventures at the city’s finest restaurants, enjoy the fresh air at our rooftop poolside restaurant and pamper yourself at Willow Stream Spa. Part of the prestigious Nile City complex, this luxury hotel is the perfect location for business events. The space consists of 845 square meters (9,100 square feet) plus 450 square meters (4,800 square feet) of outdoor space dedicated to meetings and conventions, comprising of 10 meeting rooms including a ballroom. The space also offers spectacular river Nile views.

name: City Hotel
aminities: ,Laundry service
location: 8 Aly El Kassar St. Ataba, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Nice, friendly staff in a brand new, clean hotel.  Can't beat the price for the location--right in the center of cairo very close to the Egyptian museum.  everyone is very helpful if you have any questions, and the breakfast is good.  the room is private and has its own nice modern bathroom and a TV.      address on tripadvisor is a bit off, you can find it at its address on booking is 162 El-tahrir st., tahrir sq, down town, 12621 Cairo, Egypt

name: River Nile Hostel
aminities: ,Free parking,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Wifi,Airport transportation,Meeting rooms,Laundry service,Self-serve laundry,Air conditioning,Minibar
location: 16 Cornish El Nile, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Finding an ideal small hotel in Cairo does not have to be difficult. Welcome to River Nile Hostel, a nice option for travellers like you.For those interested in checking out popular landmarks while visiting Cairo, River Nile Hostel is located a short distance from Mosque of Ibn Tulun (1.6 mi) and Gayer-Anderson Museum (Bayt al-Kiritliya) (1.7 mi).River Nile Hostel is a small hotel offering air conditioning and a minibar in the rooms, and it is easy to stay connected during your stay as free wifi is offered to guests.For guests with a vehicle, free parking is available.If you’re looking for a barbeque restaurant, consider a visit to Kebabgy, Al Refaaee, or Bab El-Sharq, which are all conveniently located a short distance from River Nile Hostel.During your visit, be sure to check out popular attractions like Old City (Coptic Cairo) (0.6 mi), Manial Palace Museum (1.0 mi), and Hanging Church (El Muallaqa, Sitt Mariam, St Mary) (0.6 mi), which are all within walking distance of the small hotel.River Nile Hostel looks forward to welcoming you on your visit to Cairo.
